So, as far as I understand things, API is a short for... application programming interface. Wikipedia gives it a nice definition: "a set of subroutine definitions, communication protocols, and tools for building software."
Are you accessing the API to have your bot do something iliar?
he probably went to sleep already
Yeah think of APIs as a way for a custom program (his bot) to interface with another software/service to tap into its functions and assets.
For example you could write a 3rd party app to create a calendar event in Google Calendar using their API "language"/functions.
or delete one, or modify it, etc etc
It allows inputs/outputs to an otherwise closed off ecosystem.
